Class Environment

  • java.lang.Object
    • Environment

  • public class Environment
extends java.lang.Object
    The environment simulates the real world in which the experiment takes place. The environment knows the time and contains the nodes. The environment advances the time and knows all the events.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      Environment(double newEventProb)
      Constructor for Environment

      This method is called in every advanceTime() step to randomly create a new event.

      set Query Periodicity of Node By default Nodes have query Periodicity with number noNode is set to be a Query node.

      • Environment

        public Environment(double newEventProb)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructor for Environment
        Parameters:
        newEventProb - Probability of creating a new event per time step and node. Probability from 0 to 1.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    • Method Detail

      • numberOfNodes

        public int numberOfNodes()
        Returns number of Nodes in Environment
        Returns:
        int number of nodes

      • setPeriodQuery

        public void setPeriodQuery(int noNodes,
                           int periodicity)
        set Query Periodicity of Node By default Nodes have query Periodicity with number noNode is set to be a Query node. Every n:th time step a query event is started where n is the periodicity argument.
        Parameters:
        noNodes - int number of Query node in Environment
        periodicity - period for creating query nodes

      • setTTLQuery

        public void setTTLQuery(int noNodes,
                        int ttlQuery)
        Set Query Time To Live (TTL) for Node with number 'noNode' in the environment.
        Parameters:
        noNodes -
        ttlQuery -

        Set Query Resend Wait time for Node with number 'noNode' in the environment.

        public int getTime()
        getter for current Time
        Returns:
        int current time.

      • neighbourInit

        public void neighbourInit(double maxDistance)
        Method to populate the neighbour lists of all nodes in the environment. The method calls the detectNeighbour method of a node to register a neighbour.
        Parameters:
        maxDistance - int send/receive distance of nodes

      • advanceTime

        public void advanceTime()
        Advance Time calls every node in the environment to make it's move and then advances the experimental time by 1.

      • addNode

        public void addNode(Node node)
        add a Node object to the Environment
        Parameters:
        node -

      • randomEvent

        public void randomEvent(Node node)
        This method is called in every advanceTime() step to randomly create a new event. It takes a Node object as parameter
        Parameters:
        node - Node for which to randomly create an event

      • periodQuery

        public void periodQuery(Node node)
        Compare experimental time with Query periodicity of each node in the Environment. If period and current time matches, a random existing event is chosen to be searched for and a new query is instantiated and put into the message queue of the current node.
        Parameters:
        node - Node object to check
